metadata.title: CVE-2024-27355 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in phpseclib 1.x before 1.0.23, 2.x before 2.0.47,and 3.x before 3.0.36. When processing the ASN.1 object identifier of acertificate, a sub identifier may be provided that leads to a denial ofservice (CPU consumption for decodeOID).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-27355` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

php-phpseclib - 2.0.47-1
No subscription required

php-seclib - 1.0.23-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: php-phpseclib package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.47-1').
php-phpseclib3 package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
phpseclib package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.23-1').
